Description.val:
The Palletized Load System Extended Service Program (PLS ESP) is a Department of the Army (DA) supported recapitalization program critical to increasing the 16.5 ton payload to include armor capability for the 10 wheel drive PLS fleet. The PLS A1 truck contains capability for onboard Load Handling System, 16.5 ton PLS trailer, PLS Enhanced Container Handling Unit (E-CHU) for transporting 20' International Organization for Standardization containers, M3 Container Roll-in/Out Platforms (CROPs), M1077 Flatracks and M1 Flatracks in an armored configuration. The PLS ESP will remanufacture and upgrade older PLS A0s to the A1 model. The PLS A1 has improved survivability with an integrated underbody A-cab and a scalable B-kit (common to the HEMTT A4), an improved powertrain, suspension and electrical system and adds an anti-lock braking system, air conditioning and traction control. The PLS fleet is an essential force sustainment enabler in transportation and ordnance formations. This program produces a like-new vehicle with a full new vehicle warranty. 

The Approved Acquisition Objective for PLS ESP is incorporated with PLS NEW at 6,956 vehicles.

Justification.val:
FY 2017 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $11.856 million supports recapitalization of a quantity of 5 PLS trucks to M1075A1 and 4 PLS trucks to M1074A1 configurations. 

FY 2017 OCO procurement funding in the amount of $106.358 million supports recapitalization of a total of 230 PLS variants to the latest A1 configuration in support of Direct Army and Army Prepositioned Stock (APS).

FY 2017 OCO includes $79.268 million to support the COCOM requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries and support the European Reassurance Initiative (ERI).  The recapitalization includes a quantity of 206 PLS trucks M1075A1 and 24 PLS trucks M1074A1 configurations.  This provisions the European Reassurance Initiative - Army Prepositioned Stock (APS) which supports the establishment of Armored Brigade Combat Teams (ABCT) for ERI. Procurement is necessary to outfit the Pre-Positioned equipment set. There is no excess inventory or viable substitute available to support the ERI requirement. APS must be filled with trucks that meet armoring requirements. 

FY 2017 OCO also includes $27.090 million in support of Operation Freedom's Sentinel (OFS) to recapitalize equipment returning from operations in theater. This supports the recapitalization of a quantity of 55 PLS trucks to M1075A1 to provide the bulk of refueling, resupply, and recovery capability throughout the Army. PLS Recapitalization incorporates the most urgently required production-ready technology and survivability enhancements for the warfighter.

System Engineering/Program Management (SEPM) includes PM and System Engineering oversight required to manage the program and provide contractor oversight. Salaries, Benefits, Travel, Personnel Training and other Government costs are included for retaining a professional acquisition workforce.

This is a Fixed Price Incentive - Firm (FPI-F) contract.  All hardware and Federal Retail Excise Tax (FRET)unit costs are calculated at ceiling cost and awarded at target cost until delivery orders are reconciled. 

The Program Manager (PM) and System Synchronization Officer (SSO) may adjust quantities to take advantage of cost savings in range pricing; allowing the PM to recap additional quantities and buy to budget.

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val: Unit costs are determined by range pricing at ceiling amount for each Ordering Year (OY).
